poem:
### The Witnesses  

Through splintered lens, a shadowed truth  
beneath a blue expanse,  
where silence mourns, and cameras still,  
in Gaza's weary dance.  

A shuttered eye of world withdrawn,  
frozen light curtailed.  
Yet stories breathe through broken glass,  
and voices, though stilled, prevail.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Guardian view on the killing of Gaza’s journalists: Israel wants to stop the world from seeing what it’s doing | Editorial Day by day, the death toll rises, the war crimes mount, and the outrage grows. Last Wednesday, the pope demanded that Israel stop its “collective punishment” of Gaza’s population. A day later, António Guterres, the United Nations secretary general, warned that “the levels of death and destruction … are without parallel in recent times”. More than 500". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
